intro: Diplanthera hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy diplanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Diplanthera hirsuta is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
